alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 3:54PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT BERNALILLO COUNTY THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 354 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southwestern Albuquerque, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Albuquerque, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, South Valley, Sandia Heights, Carnuel, and North Valley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 147 and 171. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 214 and 232. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
